description: From Latin festīnātus; festina lente (make haste slowly).

adjectives.description: festinate (comparative more festinate, superlative most festinate)

verbs.description: festinate (third-person singular simple present festinates, present participle festinating, simple past and past participle festinated)

entries.meaning: (medicine) To become involuntarily quicker, such as when walking or speaking, due to certain disorders.
